data.title: The Best Ha Dong Travel Guide & Things To Do | ORIGIN VIETNAM
data.snippet:
### 5.9 Phung Khoang Market

Phung Khoang Market is one of the largest student markets in Hanoi today. Around the market area, there are many large universities such as Hanoi University, Transport Technology, Traditional Medicine, … The market is one of the tourist, sightseeing and exploration destinations and is a favorite place for young people. The market mainly sells clothes, shoes and accessories, beautiful jewelry and trendy styles.

The items sold at the market are often seasonal and focus on low prices, so the quality is not too high. Most of the goods are divided into 2 types: fixed-price goods and goods that can be bargained. In addition, Phung Khoang market also has many different snacks such as rice paper, vermicelli with fermented shrimp paste, etc. [...] Skip to content

#### Duyen

Duyen's keen on travelling and exploring new places. By travelling, she get better at comfortable. It opens up the knowledge door for her as well.

# Ha Dong

Ha Dong is a rapidly developing district, a colorful destination for culture, cuisine and life. In addition to high-rise buildings, contemporary urban works, and a convergence of bustling markets. This place also preserves solemn and ancient temples, pagodas, small alleys full of the unique characteristics of each culture. [...] With a long history of development, Ha Dong district has attracted people from all over, creating a multicultural, multi-religious community. This diversity is not only reflected in architectural style, but also in the cuisine and multi-dimensional lifestyle of the residents.

Not only that, along with economic prosperity, Ha Dong also honors and preserves precious cultural heritages, demonstrated through the careful care of temples, churches and historical sites. The multicultural community in Ha Dong has created a diverse and rich cultural space in terms of language, costumes and customs here. It adds color to the bustling urban life here.
